critique: This document establishes civil service rules and regulations under President Grant. It aims to reduce political influence in appointments and promote merit-based hiring. It emphasizes fidelity to the Union and the Constitution. The document outlines procedures for filling vacancies in various government positions, prioritizing qualified subordinates and residents within the relevant districts. It also includes exceptions for certain positions and allows for discretionary appointments in some cases. Overall, the document seeks to professionalize the civil service and reduce patronage.
